text: these are testing times for Imran Khan
in February he had to cope with an
aerial bombing against his territory by
India and if things have gone wrong that
could have been a serious escalation
between the two nuclear powers instead
he seems to have diffused the situation
India was targeting what it claimed were
terrorists from the Jaya Shogun ization
operating against it from Pakistani
territory a lot of people in India will
see this interview with with you what
what message would you like to send the
Modi government and the people of India
surely the number one task of the two
governments should be how are we going
to reduce poverty and the way we reduce
poverty is by settling our differences
through dialogue and there is only one
difference which is Kashmir it has to be
settled the Kashmir issue cannot keep on
boiling like it is because anything
happening in Kashmir through a reaction
to the oppression which is taking place
in Kashmir it will be pawned off on
Pakistan we would be blamed and tensions
rise as they have arisen in the past so
if we can settle Kashmir the benefits of
peace are tremendous in the subcontinent
the Indian government would say you are
still simply not doing enough about
terrorism we already dismantling the
organization's as we speak
including jaj including Josh we have
taken over their madrasahs their various
the organizations they rattled around
this is the first serious effort that is
being taken to disarm the militant
groups and you have the will to see it
through do we have the will John because
it is for the future of Pakistan outside
pressure or not it is in our interest
that we do not have any militant groups
here anymore
given Pakistan's nuclear weapons
India's attacked last February could
have led to a very dangerous conflict
indeed
imran khan maintains he was determined
to make sure Pakistan's reply was
strictly limited once you respond no one
can predict where it can go from there
it could go anywhere because had they
then come back and again attacked
Pakistan Pakistan would have no choice
but to respond so in that situation two
nuclear-armed countries I just felt that
it was it was very irresponsible last
October there was trouble in the streets
right across Pakistan when the Supreme
Court acquitted a Christian woman azure
Beebe who'd been sentenced to death for
blaspheming against the Prophet Mohammed
her acquittal was confirmed in January
and she's been offered asylum in Europe
and yet she still hasn't been allowed to
leave Pakistan you will find that hacia
will be leaving very soon what are we
talking about days weeks
I think weeks we're talking about weeks
is that your decision to let her go
there's a little bit of a complication
and you know I can't speak on on on the
media about it but I can assure you
she's safe and she will be leaving in
weeks
Imran Khan her resolve following him the
officer carrying I was told the
briefcase which holds Pakistan's nuclear
codes
John Samson BBC News Islamabad
